## How to Create a Basic Solar Water Purifier

### Table of Contents
- [Introduction](#introduction)
- [Materials/Tools](#materials-tools)
- [Step-by-Step Procedure](#step-by-step-procedure)
- [Tips and Considerations](#tips-and-considerations)
- [Troubleshooting](#troubleshooting)
- [Safety Measures](#safety-measures)
- [Common Mistakes to Avoid](#common-mistakes-to-avoid)
- [Summary and Key Takeaways](#summary-and-key-takeaways)

### Introduction
In areas where clean drinking water is scarce or inaccessible, a basic solar water purifier can be a lifesaver. This guide will walk you through the process of creating a simple yet effective solar water purifier using readily available materials. By harnessing the power of the sun, you can remove impurities from water and make it safe for consumption.

### Materials/Tools
To create a basic solar water purifier, you will need the following materials/tools:
- Large plastic or glass container with a lid
- Clear plastic sheet or glass
- Small rocks or pebbles
- Sand
- Activated charcoal
- Coffee filters or cloth
- Rubber bands or string
- Water source
- Sunlight

### Step-by-Step Procedure
1. Select a large plastic or glass container with a lid. Ensure that it is clean and free from any contaminants.
2. Place a layer of small rocks or pebbles at the bottom of the container. This will act as a coarse filter to remove larger particles from the water.
3. Add a layer of sand on top of the rocks. The sand will further filter the water and remove finer particles.
4. Sprinkle a layer of activated charcoal over the sand. The activated charcoal will help remove impurities and odors from the water.
5. Cover the charcoal layer with another layer of sand. This will prevent the charcoal from mixing with the purified water.
6. Cut a piece of clear plastic sheet or glass slightly larger than the opening of the container. This will serve as the solar distillation cover.
7. Place the plastic sheet or glass over the container and secure it with rubber bands or string, ensuring a tight seal.
8. Position the container in direct sunlight, preferably on a flat surface or elevated platform.
9. As the sunlight heats the water inside the container, evaporation will occur. The water vapor will rise, condense on the plastic sheet or glass, and then drip down into the container, leaving behind impurities.
10. Allow the solar water purifier to sit in the sun for several hours to maximize the purification process.
11. Once a sufficient amount of water has been collected in the container, carefully remove the solar distillation cover.
12. Filter the purified water through coffee filters or cloth to remove any remaining particles or sediments.
13. The purified water is now ready for consumption.

### Tips and Considerations
- Choose a container that is large enough to hold an ample amount of water for your needs.
- Ensure that the container and all materials used are clean to avoid introducing additional contaminants.
- Place the solar water purifier in an area with maximum sunlight exposure for optimal results.
- Regularly clean and maintain the purifier to prevent the buildup of algae or bacteria.

### Troubleshooting
- If the water does not evaporate or condense properly, check if the container is properly sealed and the plastic sheet or glass is securely in place.
- If the water collected has an unusual taste or odor, consider replacing the activated charcoal or cleaning the container thoroughly.

### Safety Measures
- Avoid using containers made of toxic materials or those that may leach harmful substances into the water.
- Be cautious when handling hot containers or water during the purification process.
- Do not drink unpurified water from the solar water purifier.

### Common Mistakes to Avoid
- Neglecting to clean the container and materials before use can contaminate the purified water.
- Failing to properly secure the solar distillation cover may result in ineffective purification.
- Drinking water that has not been properly filtered or purified can lead to health risks.

### Summary and Key Takeaways
Creating a basic solar water purifier can provide a simple and effective solution for obtaining clean drinking water in areas with limited access. By following the step-by-step procedure outlined in this guide, you can harness the power of the sun to purify water and ensure its safety for consumption. Remember to consider the tips and safety measures provided to maximize the efficiency and effectiveness of your solar water purifier.
